entry.value:
import datetime
flowFile = session.get() if flowFile is not None: # Read the attribute value as a string excel_date_str = flowFile.getAttribute('Excel_doj')
if excel_date_str is not None and excel_date_str.strip() != "": try: # Convert the attribute value to an integer excel_date = int(excel_date_str)
java_epoch_diff = 25569.0 millis_in_day = 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000
offset_millis = int((excel_date - java_epoch_diff) * millis_in_day)
normal_date = datetime.datetime.fromtimestamp(offset_millis / 1000.0)
formatted_doj = str(normal_date)
# Store the formatted date as an attribute flowFile = session.putAttribute(flowFile, 'Formatted_doj', formatted_doj)
# Transfer the flow file to success relationship session.transfer(flowFile, REL_SUCCESS) except ValueError: # If attribute value is not a valid integer, route to failure session.transfer(flowFile, REL_FAILURE) else: # If the attribute is missing or empty, route to failure relationship session.transfer(flowFile, REL_FAILURE) else: # If no flow file received, just return session.transfer(flowFile, REL_FAILURE)

import datetime
flowFile = session.get() if flowFile is not None: # Read the attribute value as a string excel_date_str = flowFile.getAttribute('Excel_exit_date')
if excel_date_str is not None and excel_date_str.strip() != "": try: # Convert the attribute value to an integer excel_date = int(excel_date_str)
java_epoch_diff = 25569.0 millis_in_day = 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000
offset_millis = int((excel_date - java_epoch_diff) * millis_in_day)
normal_date = datetime.datetime.fromtimestamp(offset_millis / 1000.0)
formatted_exit_date = str(normal_date)
# Store the formatted date as an attribute flowFile = session.putAttribute(flowFile, 'Formatted_exit_date', formatted_exit_date)
# Transfer the flow file to success relationship session.transfer(flowFile, REL_SUCCESS) except ValueError: # If attribute value is not a valid integer, route to failure session.transfer(flowFile, REL_FAILURE) else: # If the attribute is missing or empty, route to failure relationship session.transfer(flowFile, REL_FAILURE) else: # If no flow file received, just return session.transfer(flowFile, REL_FAILURE)

import datetime

if excel_date_str is not None and excel_date_str.strip() != "": try: # Convert the attribute value to an integer excel_date = int(excel_date_str)
java_epoch_diff = 25569.0 millis_in_day = 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000
offset_millis = int((excel_date - java_epoch_diff) * millis_in_day)
normal_date = datetime.datetime.fromtimestamp(offset_millis / 1000.0)
formatted_dob = str(normal_date)
# Store the formatted date as an attribute flowFile = session.putAttribute(flowFile, 'Formatted_dob', formatted_dob)
# Transfer the flow file to success relationship session.transfer(flowFile, REL_SUCCESS) except ValueError: # If attribute value is not a valid integer, route to failure session.transfer(flowFile, REL_FAILURE) else: # If the attribute is missing or empty, route to failure relationship session.transfer(flowFile, REL_FAILURE) else: # If no flow file received, just return session.transfer(flowFile, REL_FAILURE)

entry.value:
import datetime
flowFile = session.get() if flowFile is not None: # Read the attribute value as a string excel_date_str = flowFile.getAttribute('Excel_doj')
if excel_date_str is not None and excel_date_str.strip() != "": try: # Convert the attribute value to an integer excel_date = int(excel_date_str)
java_epoch_diff = 25569.0 millis_in_day = 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000
offset_millis = int((excel_date - java_epoch_diff) * millis_in_day)
normal_date = datetime.datetime.fromtimestamp(offset_millis / 1000.0)
formatted_doj = str(normal_date)
# Store the formatted date as an attribute flowFile = session.putAttribute(flowFile, 'Formatted_doj', formatted_doj)
# Transfer the flow file to success relationship session.transfer(flowFile, REL_SUCCESS) except ValueError: # If attribute value is not a valid integer, route to failure session.transfer(flowFile, REL_FAILURE) else: # If the attribute is missing or empty, route to failure relationship session.transfer(flowFile, REL_FAILURE) else: # If no flow file received, just return session.transfer(flowFile, REL_FAILURE)

import datetime
flowFile = session.get() if flowFile is not None: # Read the attribute value as a string excel_date_str = flowFile.getAttribute('Excel_dob')
if excel_date_str is not None and excel_date_str.strip() != "": try: # Convert the attribute value to an integer excel_date = int(excel_date_str)
java_epoch_diff = 25569.0 millis_in_day = 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000
offset_millis = int((excel_date - java_epoch_diff) * millis_in_day)
normal_date = datetime.datetime.fromtimestamp(offset_millis / 1000.0)
formatted_dob = str(normal_date)
# Store the formatted date as an attribute flowFile = session.putAttribute(flowFile, 'Formatted_dob', formatted_dob)
# Transfer the flow file to success relationship session.transfer(flowFile, REL_SUCCESS) except ValueError: # If attribute value is not a valid integer, route to failure session.transfer(flowFile, REL_FAILURE) else: # If the attribute is missing or empty, route to failure relationship session.transfer(flowFile, REL_FAILURE) else: # If no flow file received, just return session.transfer(flowFile, REL_FAILURE)
